intro: Rubroshorea palembanica, commonly known as the Palembang redshorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red-veined leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
